vectorData.altText: 17. Which anatomical region of this lymph node is indicated by C?

That’s right!  ‘C’ is indicating the paracortex of the lymph node, which is the region sandwiched between cortex and medulla. T-lymphocytes enters through high endothelial venules (HEVs) and dominate in paracortex.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.

T cells dominate in the paracortex, having entered the node via the high endothelial venules, HEVs. 
Activated T cells enlarge and proliferate to form expanded clones that are distributed via efferent lymph to peripheral tissues.
